Row.Text: Oh? Judjing by your bewilderment, you can both see and hear me.[NEWLINE]My name is Murasame — Humm, so you are my Master？
An outsider like you might find things we locals take as granted to be surprising. Would like to come and visit Hoori yourself?
Oho... Teahouses of your city offer some interesting services — I would really like to visit one this time.
Hoori is a fertile land blessed by the gods. Could you also tell me about what your life was before comming here, Master?
Thank you, Master. I never realize your feeling for me were so strong. I've never been this happy in my life...
I respectfeully decline. I do not wish to get involved in this.
I had prepared some gifts just for you, Master. Look, there're boiled tamagos freshly out of Hoori's onsen... and special Goshinto Parfait from our Kanmidokoro. You just have to give them a try!
Heh... Master, you really are an honest and kind person... I'm glad to be falling in love with you.
Lines like that won't work unless you're someone more my type. Like a rugged, handsome man. Or at the very least, thirty years older than me.

You know, Master. Recently I have started to think... I may have survived for centuries all so I could meet you.[NEWLINE] In which case... I would like to put an end to this lovesickness once and for all.
Wha... What!? You intend to abandon Murasame? Do you not wish to live together with me!?
I am certain that if we pool our power and strength together, we can come up with many wonderful things, Master.
Woa — how rude! How dare you! How dare you humiliate me so, Master!
What a bastard! How could you commit such a scandalous thing... You numskull halfwit dunce! (Denounces You)
Nuwah!? What did you say!? A-A-A-Are you making a fool of me!? You're cruising for a bruising, Master!
Your words cut me deeply, Master! Take Responsibility![NEWLINE]Put 'em up! This will hurt, prepare yourself, Master!
Wh-Why...? I-I tried so hard to hold it in... I told my self I would never cry in front of anyone else...[NEWLINE]How could you do this to me, Master！
Master... you're going so far for Hoori's sake, and for my sake... I am so glad.
(You developed a long lasting relationship with Murasame)
Hey, Master! Why are you blushing!? How could you be ogling others when I'm right here!? Get a hold of yourself! Building harem is not allowed in this era!
(You didn't put effort into maintaining a good relationship with Murasame)
You have my gratitude, Master.
Wonderful! Thank you, Master.
If you say so...
Why... Master?
No Matter, the thought is enough.
That hardly makes me feel better, Master.
Gah... Must you always surprise me like this, Master?[NEWLINE]...And if someone were to be so foolish as to try, I would visit my divine wrath upon them.
I simply happened to be passing by, so I came to see how you were doing, Master. No other thoughts has ever crossed my mind.
I see... So this is a misunderstanding...
Hoori is a special place. Thinking about it in the long term, there is no reason for you to stay here.[NEWLINE]If you don't tone it down, I'll have to visit divine punishment upon you!
Fine... Are you satisfied now, Master? ...I really have a worrywart of a master.
Abusolutely not! I must always be at Master's side! Also, I'll be able to rest easy knowing M-Master is with me...
This is a laudable mindset, Master.
But this is still a problem, Master... Don't think you can escape from me so easily!
I do believe it is a little too late to be feigning composure.[NEWLINE]It's rude to eavesdrop on a maiden's monologue, Master!
Murr... so you noticed me. I never thought your senses would grow so sharp.[NEWLINE]But very well, Master. I understand where you're coming from.
No, I did little more than simply exist here. There's no need to get so worked up, is there?
Are, are you certain?
H-Hey! How dare you ignore me, Masteeeeeeer! Now I'm more worried!
You're starting off wrong, Master! People will think you're trying to recruit them into some shady cult.[NEWLINE]Master, heretic practices have poisoned your mind!
Haah... very well, I agree.[NEWLINE]You fret over others far too much, Master. If you keep this up, you'll go bald.
Wh-What are you saying!? This is not my doing! Do not pin this on me, Master!
I makes me happy to hear you say that. Thank you, Master.
Haah... What a stubborn master I have. I am disappointed.
Cherish your family. As the saying goes, you will only learn to appreciate your parents after they're gone.
